snippet: A federal indictment charges that corrupt doctors were paid $300 in cash for fraudulent medical visits that lasted a minute or two and led to the writing of prescriptions for large doses of oxycodone.
abstract: Federal indictment charges that corrupt doctors at Astramed Clinic in the Bronx were paid $300 in cash for fraudulent medical visits that lasted minute or two and led to writing of prescriptions for large doses of oxycodone; filing from federal prosecutors says that over three years, doctors wrote about 31,500 medically unnecessary prescriptions, encompassing about 5.5 million tablets with street value of up to $550 million.
lead_paragraph: A federal indictment charges that corrupt doctors were paid $300 in cash for fraudulent medical visits that lasted a minute or two and led to the writing of prescriptions for large doses of oxycodone.

headline.main: Doctors Charged in Drug Scheme at Clinic Controlled by Traffickers, Authorities Say
headline.print_headline: Doctors Charged in Drug Scheme at Clinic Controlled by Traffickers, Authorities Say
